bug.author: emailweixu
bug.summary: cmake FindPythonLibs and FindPythonIterp get inconsistent python version
bug.description: It seems that FindPythonInterp gets the version which used by user, while FindPythonLibs can get some other installled version. Should make FindPythonLibs find the one used by user. May need to write a new FindPythonLibs script.

comments.comment: I noticed that @zhangjinchao01 authored <denchmark-link:https://github.com/baidu/Paddle/blame/develop/cmake/FindPythonModule.cmake>https://github.com/baidu/Paddle/blame/develop/cmake/FindPythonModule.cmake</denchmark-link> . Is it a good idea to assign this issue to him?

Currently I am working on some compiling issues, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wangkuiyi>@wangkuiyi</denchmark-link> I will take charge of this. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/emailweixu>@emailweixu</denchmark-link> Can guide me how to reproduce this issue? PR: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/Paddle/pull/328>#328</denchmark-link>
